resources.string: A physical expression of the spirit and legend of ANZAC—dedicated to remembering all Australians who have served their country in the armed forces in wartime or on peacekeeping.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge, also affectionately known as the \'Coathanger\', was opened on March 19th 1932 by Premier Jack Lang, after six years of construction. Made of steel the bridge contains 6 million hand driven rivets.

Sydney Opera House (1957 - 1973) is a masterpiece of late modern architecture. It is admired internationally and proudly treasured by the people of Australia. It was created by a young architect, Denmark\’s Jørn Utzon).

About QVB. The Queen Victoria Building, now affectionately known as the QVB, was designed by George McRae and completed in 1898. As recently as 1959 the Queen Victoria Building was threatened with demolition.
St Mary\'s Cathedral is the spiritual home of Sydney\'s Catholic community. It is the seat of the Archbishop of Sydney, and stands on the site of the first Catholic Chapel in Australia.
Bondi Beach is a popular beach and the name of the surrounding suburb in Sydney, New South Wales. It is located 7 km (4 mi) east of the Sydney central business district.

Clovelly Beach is a small beach that sits on the end of the narrow bay. The bay is popular with swimmers. The bay is home to one of the first surf lifesaving clubs in the world, Clovelly Surf Life Saving Club, which was founded in 1906.
Coogee is a delightful seaside destination for families, with a patrolled beach, swimming baths and a promenade with barbeque areas and playgrounds.
Situated between a tranquil inner-harbour beach on one side and a popular surf beach on the other, Manly combines a laid-back beachside attitude with sophisticated dining and shopping.
Found just over an hour’s drive from the centre of Sydney, Palm Beach is home to the city\’s most northerly stretch of sand.

The Royal Botanic Garden Sydney is a major botanical garden located in the heart of Sydney, Australia. Opened in 1816, the garden is the oldest scientific institution in Australia and one of the most important historic botanical institutions in the world.
Hyde Park, the oldest public parkland in Australia, is a 16.2-hectare (40-acre) park in the central business district of Sydney. It is famed for its magnificent fig tree lined avenues.
Visit Luna Park Sydney to catch a concert at the Big Top, eat classy cuisine at The Deck or take in the million dollar views as you ride the Ferris Wheel, as folks have been doing since 1935.

Ocean pools are an important feature of the Australian coastline particularly in New South Wales. Ocean pools or ocean baths are defined as public seawater pools sited on a rocky surf coast, so that waves can wash into the pool.
Taronga Zoo is Australia\'s leading zoological park, featuring a comprehensive collection of both native and exotic species.
If you like the sound of spicy lamb shish kebabs toasted over charcoal, visit Gozde or any of the dozen kebab joints in the Turkish enclave of Auburn.
For Vietnamese spring rolls or beef pho (broth with noodles), visit Cabramatta\'s John Street.
Crispy Asian-style barbecued food can be found in Chinatown, where Dae Jang Kum Korean, Nagoya Yakiniku Japanese and Genghis Khan Mongolian have perfected the art of grilling duck, fish and meats.
The eclectic restaurants, bars and cafes that run the length of Newtown\’s King street and up to Enmore Road make for a vibrant food scene.
the Lebanese restaurants of Surry Hills\’ Cleveland Street and Lakemba are hard to beat.
